crystals have been used throughout all
of history as a source of healing power
ancient cultures all over the world used
healing crystals and stones to align
clear and transform their energy spirit
and physical health the metaphysical
powers of crystals were no mystery to
most ancient cultures including the
Egyptians Mayans and Sumerians who
regularly adorn their bodies jewelry and
buildings with these sacred stones the
first historical references to the use
of crystals come from the ancient
Sumerians who included crystals in magic
formulas the ancient Egyptians used
lapis lazuli turquoise carnelian emerald
and clear quartz in their jewelry they
also carved grave amulets of the same
gems the ancient Egyptians used stones
primarily for protection and health
chrysolite later translated as both
topaz and peridot was used to combat
severe nightmares and purge evil spirits
the ancient Egyptians also used crystals
for cosmetic purposes the Galena witches
led or was ground to a powder and used
as the eye shadow known as Kohl
malachite was used in a similar manner
green stones in general were used to
signify the heart of the deceased and
were included in burials green stones
were used in a similar way at a later
period by the cultures residing in
ancient Mexico
the ancient Greeks attributed a number
of properties to crystals and many names
we use today are of Greek origin the
word crystal comes from the Greek word
for ice as it was believed that clear
quartz was water that had frozen so
deeply that it would always remain solid
the word amethyst means not drunken and
was worn as an amulet to prevent both
drunkenness and hangovers hematite comes
from the word for blood because of the
red coloration produced when it oxidizes
hematite is an iron ore and the ancient
Greeks associated iron with Ares the God
of War Greek soldiers would rub hematite
over their bodies before battle
purportedly to make themselves involve
Greek sailors also wore a variety of
amulets to keep them safe at sea the
magical properties of crystals were used
even in China Jade was highly valued in
ancient China and some Chinese written
characters represent Jade beads musical
instruments in the form of chimes were
made from Jade and around 1000 years ago
some Chinese emperors were buried in
Jade armor
there are burials with Jade masks from
around the same period also in Mexico
Jade was recognized as a kidney healing
stone both in China and South America
more recently dating from around 250
years ago the Modi's of New Zealand or

generations through the male line the

continues in parts of New Zealand to
this day
